greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of n X n matrices with entries in {0,1} with no zero row, no zero column and with zero main diagonal.
comment: Also the number of simple labeled digraphs on n nodes for which every vertex has indegree at least one and outdegree at least one.
Also the number of edge covers on the n-crown graph. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, May 19 2017
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..50
R. W. Robinson. Counting digraphs with restrictions on the strong components, (1996). W(n).
R. W. Robinson, Counting digraphs with restrictions on the strong components, 1996 [Local copy, with permission]
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Crown Graph
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Edge Cover
formula: a(n) = sum( f(n, r), r=0..n ) where f(n, r) = binomial(n, r) (-1)^r (1-2^(-n+r+1))^(n-r) (1-2^(-n+r))^r 2^((n-r)(n-1)). - _Brendan McKay_, Aug 27 2003
mathematica: Table[ it = (Partition[ #1, n ] &) /@ IntegerDigits[ Range[ 0, -1 + 2^n^2 ], 2, n^2 ]; Count[ it, (q_)?MatrixQ /; Tr[ q ] === 0 && (Times @@ (Plus @@@ q)) > 0 && (Times @@ (Plus @@@ Transpose[ q ]) > 0) ], {n, 1, 4} ] (* _Wouter Meeussen_, Aug 25 2003 *)
Table[Sum[(-1)^(n-r)*Binomial[n, r]*(2^(r-1)-1)^r*(2^r-1)^(n-r), {r,0,n}],{n,1,15}] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, May 04 2015 after _Vladeta Jovovic_ *)
results.author: _W. Edwin Clark_, Aug 25 2003
